body.name: Filmish: A Graphic Journey Through Film (Non-Fiction - SelfMadeHero)

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Should be Required Reading Before Watching Any Film
reviews.reviewText: Film theory in a nutshell; takeaways from each chapter are numerous and meaningful. Masterfully put together considering so many issues are covered. Should be required reading before watching any film.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Theory and film in a comic
reviews.reviewText: Filmish by Edward Ross draws on cinema to work through the conventions of a graphic novel. Ross weaves theory into the mix, citing theorists like Laura Mulvey. The book is broken into sections, each one illuminating a different affordance of film.Of course, the book is profligate with examples, with film including early examples up to titles released in recent years. I would use this book as a teacher of media, but also found it informative and useful as a reader.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2018
reviews.reviewText: I bought this item as a gift to a film student. Before gifting, my cursory examination reveal it to be well crafted with clever illustrations. Exactly the type of thing for those comfortable with the graphic novel format.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome book! Used it in my Film Analysis and ...
reviews.reviewText: Awesome book! Used it in my Film Analysis and Criticism class and I can safely say is the best "textbook" I've ever had to read for class. Interesting info and cool comic book layout.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great guide for young film students
reviews.reviewText: I teach filmmaking to teenagers, so I am always on the lookout for new teaching tools and resources. This is an excellent introduction to film theory for young people who have developed an enthusiasm for movies but know nothing about film studies. Not only is the graphic approach fun, fast and easy to understand but Ross has essentially created a superb illustrated bibliography here for those wanting a jumping off place into more in-depth study. If I taught an undergraduate college course in film history or appreciation, this would be required reading—I would also give it to advanced high school students.My one beef with Ross's approach is that I find him to present a number of popular critical positions somewhat uncritically himself. There is a lot of pleasure and enrichment to be had in movies that may be, for one reason or another, "problematic," from within a certain context. For some students, this book might lead to pre-judgement of works they have not experienced first hand.Overall, though, if taken for the many ways it is useful and enjoyable, an excellent guide.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars This book is fine, and not a waste of time
reviews.reviewText: This book is fine, and not a waste of time. Still, if you're interested in learning about film, you're better off watching The Story of Film (actually, do this anyway) or reading any of a number of other introductory texts (Amazon will likely point you in the right direction). If you're interested in the graphic info-novel format, this might be a good bet for you, though I question the idea of trying to talk about film using a combination of simple pictures and sparse text -- I could imagine this format working, but I don't think it does in this case. Also, this is just my personal taste, but I also didn't love (a) the prose [it tended towards the cliche and vague] or (b) the omnipresence of the narrator's (authors?) face.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2019
reviews.reviewText: Bought as a graduation gift for film student. This is a truly marvelous and fun book! Great history, fun reading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great item, great price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 29, 2022
reviews.reviewText: A perfect little coffee table book, easy to pick up and read but beautifully illustrated. Surprisingly covers a lot of film history in clever and interesting ways.

Increíble libro ilustrado que resume muy bien la historia del cine en capítulos visualmente divertidos y muy interesantes. La sorpresa que me llevé es que el autor, además de tener amplio conocimiento de la evolución del cine, también deja unos planteamientos y reflexiones muy interesantes para todx aquel que guste de este arte.Muy recomendable, para principiantes y un poco más.
A real pleasure for a movie fan and a graphic story fan!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 23, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Enjoyed the quirky style and content, interesting although not a film buff.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 16, 2018
reviews.reviewText: A fantastic overview of the world of film, and a highly recommended starting point for anyone wanting to learn more about film theory. A joy from start to finish, with the author's love of film leaping from every panel.
